definition: palm of the hand/sole of the foot/paw/horseshoe/to slap/to hold in one's hand/to wield
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: Applause is sweeping through the trees.
sentences.chinese: 帷幕降下，樹叢間掌聲雷動。

sentences.english: I finished and, to my surprise, the class broke out in applause.
sentences.chinese: 我朗誦完了，令我大爲驚訝的是，全班掌聲雷動。

sentences.english: As(when)he finished the speech, the audience burst into applause.
sentences.chinese: 他講話結束的時候，聽衆掌聲雷動。

sentences.english: I was awakened out of my musings16 by the thunderous applause when we entered the stadium.
sentences.chinese: 當我們進入體育場時，掌聲雷動，把我從沉思中驚醒。

sentences.english: Colin left the stage after an hour to rapturous applause.
sentences.chinese: 柯林黑唱了一小時後在掌聲雷動中下了臺。

sentences.english: When they were over, the room erupted in applause.
sentences.chinese: 演示完畢，房間裏掌聲雷動。

sentences.english: The students, according to published accounts of the address, responded with enthusiastic applause.
sentences.chinese: 據媒體報道，當時臺下學生掌聲雷動。

sentences.english: He stood briefly to acknowledge the crowd and received a round of warm applause.
sentences.chinese: 他稍事站立，以向觀衆致意，掌聲雷動。
